content:
The IG Publisher (current build v3.1.0-12574) is hanging after generating narratives from https://github.com/hl7au/au-fhir-base:

Load Configuration from C:\work\git\au-fhir-base\ig.json                         (00.0000sec)
Root directory: C:\work\git\au-fhir-base                                         (00.0073sec)
Terminology Cache is at C:\work\git\au-fhir-base\txCache. 21 files in cache      (00.0231sec)
Fetch Validation Pack from http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/igpack.zip                   (00.0232sec)
Local Validation Pack from cache location C:\work\git\au-fhir-base\txCache\validation-3.0.1.zip using version 3.0.1 (00.0232sec)
Definitions 3.0.1-11917                                                          (25.0463sec)
Load Terminology Cache from C:\work\git\au-fhir-base\txCache                     (25.0467sec)
Connect to Terminology Server at http://tx.fhir.org/r3                           (25.0467sec)
Initialization complete                                                          (27.0944sec)
Load Content                                                                     (27.0944sec)
Processing Conformance Resources                                                 (33.0182sec)
Generating Narratives                                                            (48.0292sec)

This is happening with more than one IG build and a colleague has reverted changes made in one IG to last week when it was known to be working, but the reverted IG hung as well.
Any suggestions?

@Brett Esler When I use the command line execution I get the following error message "Failed to find referenced profile ..." that is not in the GUI output:

Processing Conformance Resources                                  (35.0752sec)
Failed to find referenced profile: http://hl7.org.au/fhir/StructureDefinition/nofixedaddress
Generating Narratives                                                               (53.0226sec)

When this is put into the browser I get a "Page not found" for http://www.hl7.org.au/fhir/StructureDefinition/nofixedaddress, but http://www.hl7.org.au/fhir/StructureDefinition-nofixedaddress resolves.
